text: Everywoman was a weekly radio magazine programme broadcast on BBC World Service between March 1997 and April 2006. Billed as for and about women, the programme covered a variety of social, political, environmental, and health issues from a woman's viewpoint.BBC World Service | "Everywoman" Everywoman was regularly presented by Anna Umbima, Jane Garvey, and Shyama Perera.BBC World Service | " Presenters of Everywoman" The song "Agolo" by Angélique Kidjo, was popularised by its use as the programme's theme tune.BBC | Press Office | "Theme music success for BBC World Service series Everywoman" Everywoman was axed in October 2005 as part of a shake-up of World Service programming, and ended in April 2006.Michael Church: The needless destruction of a cultural treasure The Independent, 14 October 2005. Archived episodes of the programme have since been made available on the BBC website. ==References== ==External links== * BBC Everywoman archive Category:1997 radio programme debuts Category:BBC World Service programmes
